ratings.comment: I really enjoyed this class! It was definitely a lot of papers and readings, but if you like that kind of work then I would recommend taking this class. The material discussed was really interesting.

Dr. Bosco's lectures were boring and she did not seem to be an expert in the field at all. She is overall just a poor lecturer who needs to change her approach to engage and teach more effectively. She struggled with basic technology all semester, and shared personal political opinions in a way that seemed to isolate students who thought different.

Professor Bosco and the TAs were very nice and understanding, but the class was poorly put together and lots of the material didn't really correlate. There was a ton of writing and the readings are marginally important and can be skimmed through.

She is a nice person, but not a great professor. Participation matters in discussions because you are graded weekly, 2-3 page papers are due every week with longer papers/projects due every 6 weeks. Lots of reading, but I would just skim for the main idea. Usually, material from lectures didn't really relate to weekly assignments.

I believe Dr. Bosco was commissioned to teach this class at the last minute; this was her 1st time teaching it I think. Not a great lecturer. Never spoke with them directly; was way closer with my TA. The readings were important and interesting, but the lectures were pretty boring. It's an easy class if you do the work. They accepted late work too.

Worst class I've taken. Bosco is a nice, passionate person, but terrible instructor. Lecture, readings, and assignments didn't correlate. The weekly 2+ page papers were excessive and annoying to complete, and despite providing a clear rubric, there are just too many nit-picky things. Flat out responding to the rubric is your best bet at an A.
